revision.text:
{{About|the Mexican footballer|the Argentine singer|Raúl Giménez}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Spanish name|Jiménez|Rodríguez}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Raúl Jiménez | image = Raul Jiménez.png | image_size = 175 | caption = Jiménez in 2017 | fullname = Raúl Alonso Jiménez Rodríguez{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/844127|title=2018/19 Premier League squads confirmed|publisher=Premier League|date=3 September 2018|access-date=4 September 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=y|1991|5|5}} | birth_place = [[Tepeji]], [[Hidalgo (state)|Hidalgo]], Mexico | height = 1.90 m{{cite web|title=Raúl Jiménez|url=https://www.wolves.co.uk/team/first-team/raúl-jiménez/|website=Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|access-date=28 August 2018}} | position = [[Forward (association football)#Forward|Forward]] | currentclub = [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]
(on loan from [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]]) | clubnumber = 9 | youthyears1 = 2008–2011 | youthclubs1 = [[Club América|América]] | years1 = 2011–2014 | clubs1 = [[Club América|América]] | caps1 = 96 | goals1 = 36 | years2 = 2014–2015 | clubs2 = [[Atlético Madrid]] | caps2 = 21 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2015– | clubs3 = [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] | caps3 = 80 | goals3 = 18 | years4 = 2018– | clubs4 = → [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] (loan) | caps4 = 29 | goals4 = 11 | nationalyears1 = 2012 | nationalteam1 = [[Mexico national under-23 football team|Mexico U23]] | nationalcaps1 = 13 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2013– | nationalteam2 = [[Mexico national football team|Mexico]] | nationalcaps2 = 70 | nationalgoals2 = 15 | club-update = 14:07, 2 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 25 November 2018 | medaltemplates = {{MedalSport|Men's [[Association football|football]]}} {{MedalCountry|{{fb|MEX}}}} {{MedalOlympic}} {{MedalGold|[[2012 Summer Olympics|2012 London]]|[[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|Team]]}} }} '''Raúl Alonso Jiménez Rodríguez''' ({{IPA-es|raˈul xiˈmenes|am}}; born 5 May 1991) is a Mexican professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[forward (association football)|forward]] for English club [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]], on loan from [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]], and the [[Mexico national football team|Mexico national team]]. He began his career in [[Club América]]'s [[Club América Reserves|youth system]] before debuting in the [[Primera División de México|first division]] in October 2011. He won his first championship with América in 2013, winning the [[2012–13 Liga MX season#Clausura|Clausura]] tournament, and was the team's second-highest goalscorer. In August 2014, Jiménez was sold to Spanish club [[Atlético Madrid]], who were the reigning league champions. After one season he was sold to Benfica, with whom he won two consecutive [[Primeira Liga|league]] titles, among other major honours. Jiménez was a part of the [[Mexico national under-23 football team|Mexican squad]] that won the gold medal at the [[Summer Olympics]] in [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics|2012]].{{cite web|title=Mexico's breath of fresh air|url=https://www.fifa.com/confederationscup/news/newsid=2116453/|publisher=[[FIFA]]|access-date=23 June 2013}} A full international since 2013, Jiménez has represented his country at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014]] and [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], the [[2013 CONCACAF Gold Cup]], the [[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup|2013]] and [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup]], the [[2015 Copa América]], and the [[Copa América Centenario]]. ==Club career== ===América=== ====2011–12 season==== Jiménez began his career playing for [[Club América]]'s [[Club América Reserves|youth system]], being considered a promising young striker. On 9 October 2011, under interim-coach [[Alfredo Tena]], Jiménez made his professional debut during the [[2011–12 Club América season#Apertura|Apertura]] tournament against [[Monarcas Morelia]], in a match which ended in a 1–1 draw.{{cite web|last=Alcibvia|first=Rafael|title=América 1-1 Morelia… Las Águilas se alejaron de la calificación|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2011/10/09/america-1-1-morelia-las-aguilas-se-alejaron-de-la-calificacion_35689|publisher=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish|access-date=9 October 2011}} He scored his first goal on 30 October in a 2–3 loss to [[Puebla FC|Puebla]], scoring in the 2nd minute of the match.{{cite web|last=Alcivia|first=Rafael|title=América 2-3 Puebla... Las Águilas se despidieron del Azteca con derrota|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2011/10/30/america-2-3-puebla-las-aguilas-se-despidieron-del-azteca-con-derrota_35725|publisher=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish|access-date=30 October 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111031173139/http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2011/10/30/america-2-3-puebla-las-aguilas-se-despidieron-del-azteca-con-derrota_35725|archive-date=31 October 2011|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} He appeared six times and scored one goal in his debut tournament. Jiménez did not appear in the [[2011–12 Club América season#Clausura|Clausura 2012]] until 11 February—week seven of the tournament—against [[Club Atlas|Atlas]], which ended in a 1–1 draw, coming on as a second-half substitute for [[Christian Bermúdez]].{{cite web|last=Garrido|first=José Maria|title=Atlas 1-1 América... Húmedo empate en el Jalisco |url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2012/02/11/atlas-1-1-america-humedo-empate-en-el-jalisco_40030|publisher=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish|access-date=11 February 2012}} He scored his first goal of the tournament on 9 March in the 1–1 draw against [[Club Tijuana|Tijuana]] at the [[Estadio Caliente]].{{cite web|last=Zamora|first=Jessica|title=Tijuana 1-1 América... Con nueve, Xolos rescató empate ante el Águila |url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2012/03/09/tijuana-1-1-america-con-nueve-xolos-rescato-empate-ante-el-aguila_40066|publisher=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish|access-date=9 March 2012}} Jiménez appeared twelve times and scored once during the Clausura, with América being eliminated in the semi-finals by [[C.F. Monterrey|Monterrey]]. ====2012–13 season==== After participating in the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics|Summer Olympics]] with [[Mexico national under-23 football team|Mexico]] and the sale of [[Vicente Matías Vuoso]], Jiménez won a spot in América's starting eleven for the [[2012–13 Club América season#Apertura|Apertura 2012]] tournament, playing as a second-striker alongside [[Christian Benítez]] in manager [[Miguel Herrera]]'s 5-3-2 tactical scheme. He was also given the vacant number 9 shirt, switching from the number 47 shirt he debuted with. Jiménez scored on 15 September in the 2–0 victory over [[Santos Laguna]] at the [[Estadio Azteca]].{{cite web|last=Malagón|first=Edgar|title=América 2-0 Santos... Águilas abollan corona del Campeón|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2012/09/15/america-2-0-santos-aguilas-abollan-corona-del-campeon_41323|publisher=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish|access-date=15 September 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120918193140/http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2012/09/15/america-2-0-santos-aguilas-abollan-corona-del-campeon_41323|archivedate=18 September 2012|df=}} He would go on to score two weeks later in the 1–1 draw against Monarcas Morelia.{{cite web|last=Montes|first=Jose Martín|title=América 1-1 Morelia... Ninguno convence|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2012/09/29/america-1-1-morelia-ninguno-convence_41342|publisher=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish|access-date=29 September 2012}} Jiménez received his first red card during América's 2–1 victory over [[San Luis F.C.|San Luis]], meaning he would miss ''[[El Súper Clásico (Mexico)|El Súper Clásico]]'' against [[C.D. Guadalajara|Guadalajara]].{{cite web|last=Terán|first=Jose Manuel|title=San Luis 1-2 América... 'Chucho' Benítez regresó y el Águila voló|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2012/10/02/san-luis-1-2-america-chucho-benitez-regreso-y-el-aguila-volo_41353|publisher=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish|access-date=2 October 2012}} On 3 November, he scored the second goal in the 4–0 win over [[C.F. Pachuca|Pachuca]].{{cite web|last=Terán|first=Jose Manuel|title=América 4-0 Pachuca... 'Chucho' destrozó las esperanzas tuzas|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2012/11/03/america-4-0-pachuca-chucho-destrozo-las-esperanzas-tuzas_41395|publisher=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish|access-date=3 November 2012}} On 17 November, Jiménez scored in the 1–2 defeat to Morelia in the second-leg of the quarter-final. Despite the loss, América won the series by a 3–2 aggregate score and advanced to the semi-finals.{{cite web|last=Montes|first=Juan Martín|title=América (3)1-2(2) Morelia... Clasificación dramática|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2012/11/17/america-3-1-2-2-morelia-clasificacion-dramatica_44693|publisher=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish|access-date=17 November 2012}} América would ultimately be eliminated in the semi-finals by [[Club Toluca|Toluca]]. Jimenéz ended the tournament with sixteen appearances and scoring four goals. Jiménez began the [[2012–13 Club América season#Clausura|Clausura 2013]] tournament as a starter in the first two league matches, and scored his first [[brace (sports)|brace]] in the 4–0 victory over [[C.F. Atlante|Atlante]] on 19 January.{{cite web|last=Terán|first=Jose Manuel|title=América 4-0 Atlante... Águilas de hierro|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2013/01/19/america-4-0-atlante-aguilas-de-hierro_44848|publisher=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish|access-date=19 January 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130121133301/http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2013/01/19/america-4-0-atlante-aguilas-de-hierro_44848|archivedate=21 January 2013|df=}} He bagged another brace on 2 February in América's 3–0 win against [[Querétaro F.C.|Querétaro]].{{cite web|title=Regresa América al triunfo y sin esforzarse vence 3-0 a Querétaro|url=http://espndeportes.espn.go.com/futbol/cronica?id=358800|publisher=ESPN Deportes|language=Spanish|access-date=2 February 2013}} On 31 March, Jiménez scored two headers in the 2–0 victory over Guadalajara at the [[Estadio Omnilife]].{{cite web|last=McCauley|first=Kevin|title=Chivas Guadalajara vs. Club América, 2013 Super Clasico: Final score 0-2, Goats crumble|url=https://www.sbnation.com/soccer/2013/3/31/4168952/chivas-vs-america-2013-super-clasico-final-score-result|publisher=SB Nation|access-date=31 March 2013}} Jimenéz finished the regular phase of the tournament with eight goals, and scored in América's 1–0 away win over [[Club Universidad Nacional|Pumas UNAM]] in the first-leg of the quarter-final series of the playoffs on 8 May.{{cite web|last=Collazo|first=Jonathan|title=América vuela otra vez ante Pumas, ahora en Liguilla|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2013/05/08/america-vuela-otra-vez-ante-pumas-ahora-en-liguilla_46933|publisher=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish|access-date=8 May 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130606223702/http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2013/05/08/america-vuela-otra-vez-ante-pumas-ahora-en-liguilla_46933|archive-date=6 June 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} In the second-leg of the semi-final series against Monterrey, Jimenéz scored from a [[penalty kick (association football)|penalty]] and assisted Christian Benitez in the second goal to win the match 2–1 (4–3 on aggregate), sending América to the [[2013 Liga MX Clausura Liguilla#Final|Final]] against [[Cruz Azul]].{{cite web|title=América vence 2-1 a Monterrey y 'vuela' a la final del futbol mexicano|url=http://mexico.cnn.com/deportes/2013/05/18/america-monterrey-liguilla-semifinal-futbol|publisher=CNN México|language=Spanish|access-date=18 May 2013}} Jiménez played in both legs and scored in the subsequent penalty shoot-out which América ultimately won, thus being crowned league champions.{{cite web|title=¡América es Campeón de la Liga MX!|url=http://www.clubamerica.com.mx/single.php?id=8847|website=''ClubAmérica.com.mx''|publisher=Club América|language=Spanish|access-date=27 May 2013}}{{dead link|date=April 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} ====2013–14 season==== On 3 August 2013 Jiménez scored his first goal of the [[2013–14 Liga MX season|Apertura]] tournament in the 3–0 win over Atlas.{{cite web|title=América 3-0 Atlas: Las Águilas homenajearon con goles a 'Chucho' Benítez|url=http://futbol.univision.com/article/1625289/2013-08-03/mexico/america-3-0-atlas-cronica-jornada-4-liga-mx|website=''Univision.com''|publisher=Univision||language=Spanish|access-date=3 August 2013}} He would go on to score in the following three-consecutive matches in wins over [[Atlante FC|Atlante]], Pachuca, and Morelia, respectively, taking his goal tally to four goals in five matches played. He would score again on 13 September in América's 1–2 defeat to Santos Laguna.{{cite web|last=Ruiz|first=Alberto|date=13 September 2013|title=Santos freno el vueló del ave|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/mexico/cronicas/2013/09/13/santos-freno-el-vuelo-del-ave_47459|publisher=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish|access-date=13 September 2013}} On 5 October, Jiménez scored a header and assisted in [[Luis Gabriel Rey]]'s goal in the 2–0 victory over Guadalajara.{{cite web|last=McCauley|first=Kevin|date=5 October 2013|title=Club America vs. Chivas Guadalajara: Final score 2-0, Raul Jimenez the Super Eagles' hero|url=https://www.sbnation.com/soccer/2013/10/5/4807156/america-vs-chivas-2013-super-clasico-final-score-result-liga-mx|publisher=SB Nation|access-date=5 October 2013}} Jiménez ended the regular-phase of the Apertura with seven goals in twelve games played. He scored in the second-leg of the quarter-finals against [[Tigres UANL]] which ended in a 1–1 draw at the Estadio Azteca on 1 December, with América advancing, despite a 2–2 aggregate score, due to the away-goals rule.{{cite web|title=América 1-1 Tigres|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/ficha.php?id_partido=51025|publisher=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish|access-date=1 December 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131206035430/http://www.mediotiempo.com/ficha.php?id_partido=51025|archivedate=6 December 2013|df=}} América would win the semi-final matches against Toluca and advance once again to the league final, though failing to achieve the repeat after losing both legs to [[Club León|León]].{{cite web|last=Contreras Legaspi|first=Carlos|date=15 December 2013|title=León, campeón del Apertura 2013|url=http://laaficion.milenio.com/futbol/Espiritu-campeon_0_208779160.html|website=''La Afición''|publisher=Grupo Milenio|language=Spanish|access-date=15 December 2013}} The [[2013–14 Liga MX season#Clausura|Clausura 2014]] tournament saw Jiménez make 17 appearances and score 8 goals.{{Medio Tiempo|raul-alonso-jimenez}} In the quarter-final match against [[Club Santos Laguna|Santos Laguna]] on 30 April, Jiménez scored a hat-trick in the 5–3 win.{{cite web|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/ficha.php?id_partido=53431|title=América 5 - 3 Santos - mediotiempo.com|date=30 April 2014|work=mediotiempo.com|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140505130205/http://www.mediotiempo.com/ficha.php?id_partido=53431|archivedate=5 May 2014|df=}} However, América would lose the second-leg of the series 1–3 and being eliminated from the playoffs, despite a 6–6 aggregate score due to the away-goals rule.{{cite web|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/ficha.php?id_partido=53435|title=Santos 3 - 1 América - mediotiempo.com|date=3 May 2014|work=mediotiempo.com|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140508162218/http://www.mediotiempo.com/ficha.php?id_partido=53435|archivedate=8 May 2014|df=}} ====2014–15 season==== Jiménez began the [[2014–15 Liga MX season|Apertura 2014]] tournament scoring four goals in the first three games. On 26 July, he scored the first goal in América's 2–1 win over Tijuana. On 4 August, he scored a hat-trick and assisted [[Oribe Peralta]] in the 4–0 win against [[Puebla F.C.|Puebla]].{{cite web |url=http://www.ligamx.net/home/noticia.html?id=8232 |title=Archived copy |access-date=4 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140808055152/http://www.ligamx.net/home/noticia.html?id=8232 |archivedate=8 August 2014 |df= }} Jiménez played his final game for América on 9 August 2014 against Tigres UANL, providing the assist for the second goal scored by [[Miguel Layún]] in the 2–0 win. ===Atlético Madrid=== [[File:Raúl Jiménez DEP-ATM 045 1200.jpg|thumb|250px|Jiménez playing for [[Atlético Madrid]] in 2015]] On 13 August 2014, [[Atlético Madrid]] reached an agreement with Club América for Jiménez,{{cite news|title=Agreement with América for the transfer of Raúl Jiménez|url=http://en.clubatleticodemadrid.com/noticias/agreement-with-america-for-the-transfer-of-raul-jimenez|publisher=[[Atlético Madrid]]|date=13 August 2014|access-date=14 August 2014}} for a fee reported to be in the region of €11 million.{{cite news|title=El Atlético ficha a Raúl Jiménez|trans-title=Atlético signs Raúl Jiménez|url=http://www.marca.com/2014/08/12/futbol/equipos/atletico/1407844236.html|publisher=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|language=es|date=12 August 2014|access-date=14 August 2014}} The following day, he signed a six-year deal after passing the medical examination.{{cite news|title=Welcome Raúl Jiménez|url=http://en.clubatleticodemadrid.com/noticias/welcome-raul-jimenez|publisher=[[Atlético Madrid]]|date=14 August 2014|access-date=12 September 2014}} Jiménez made his debut on 16 August, in the final of the [[Ramón de Carranza Trophy]] pre-season tournament against [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]], starting the match and being substituted out in the 79th minute. Atlético won 2–0.{{cite web|title=Raúl Jiménez ganó primer titulo con el 'Atleti'|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/libertadores/noticias/2014/08/16/raul-jimenez-gano-primer-titulo-con-el-atleti|publisher=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish|access-date=16 August 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140817180737/http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/libertadores/noticias/2014/08/16/raul-jimenez-gano-primer-titulo-con-el-atleti|archivedate=17 August 2014|df=}} Jiménez made his competitive debut in the first leg of the [[2014 Supercopa de España|Supercopa de España]] on 19 August, a 1–1 draw against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], playing the final 12 minutes in place of fellow debutant [[Mario Mandžukić]].{{cite news|title=Spanish Super Copa: Real Madrid and Atletico draw 1–1 in first leg|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/325067/report|access-date=20 August 2014|work=[[Sky Sports News]]|date=19 August 2014}} Jiménez played in the second leg as well coming in as a substitute for [[Antoine Griezmann]] in the 73rd minute of the match, the game ended in a 1–0 win and an aggregated score of 2–1.{{cite web|last=Jenson|first=Peter|date=22 August 2014|title=Atletico Madrid 1-0 Real Madrid (agg 2-1): Cristiano Ronaldo, Gareth Bale and James Rodriguez fail to fire as quickfire Mario Mandzukic secures Spanish Super Cup for Diego Simeone|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2732278/Atletico-Madrid-1-0-Real-Madrid-agg-2-1-Cristiano-Ronaldo-Gareth-Bale-James-Rodriguez-fail-fire-quickfire-Mario-Mandzukic-secures-Spanish-Super-Cup-Diego-Simeone.html|work=[[Daily Mail]]|access-date=22 August 2014}} Jiménez made his [[2014–15 La Liga|La Liga]] debut on 25 August 2014, in a goalless draw against [[Rayo Vallecano]]. He scored his first league goal for Atlético on 27 September, in a 4–0 win against [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]], coming off the bench. It was his only goal for Atlético that season.{{Soccerway|access-date=7 August 2015}} ===Benfica=== On 9 August 2015 Jiménez, who was expected to complete a loan deal to [[Premier League]] side [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham]], failed to show up to his medical after reports claimed he had missed his flight to [[London]] after he had overslept.{{cite web|title=Raúl Jiménez overslept and missed West Ham medical|url=http://as.com/diarioas/2015/08/09/english/1439150331_086804.html|publisher=[[Diario AS]]|access-date=14 August 2015|date=9 August 2015}} However, multiple sources had reported his agent [[Jorge Mendes]] had suggested he spurn the move, in favour of a move to [[Primeira Liga]] side [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]]. On 13 August 2015, Jiménez joined Portuguese champions Benfica, signing a five-year deal.{{cite web |url=http://www.slbenfica.pt/noticias/detalhedenoticia/tabid/2788/ArticleId/42641/language/pt-PT/.aspx |title=Mostrar que posso ajudar a equipa |language=Portuguese |trans-title=Show that I can help the team |date=13 August 2015 |publisher=[[S.L. Benfica]] |access-date=13 August 2015}} Benfica spent €9.836 million to bring Jiménez to the club, although this included unspecified amounts on agent's fees and signing-on fees in addition to the transfer fee itself.{{cite web|url=http://web3.cmvm.pt/sdi/emitentes/docs/fsd150611.pdf#66|date=14 April 2016|title=Prospeto de oferta pública(...)|website=CMVM|language=Portuguese|format=PDF|page=66|access-date=21 July 2016}} The €9.836 million may have included a €1 million transfer fee, and €3 million to acquire 50% of the player's economic rights.{{cite web|title=Mexico striker Raul Jimenez reaches deal to join Benfica|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2561904/mexicos-raul-jimenez-reaches-deal-to-join-benfica|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|access-date=14 August 2015|date=13 August 2015}} ====2015–16 season==== [[File:Zen-benf16 (1).jpg|thumb|Jiménez playing for [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] in the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League]]]] Jiménez scored his first goal for Benfica on 29 August against [[Moreirense]], scoring a header in the 75th minute to level the score 1–1, with Benfica eventually winning the match 3–2.{{cite web|title=Benfica fights back for 3-2 win over Moreirense|url=http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/story/benfica-fights-back-for-3-2-win-over-moreirense-082915|website=Fox Sports|access-date=29 August 2015}} On 26 November, Jiménez scored his first two goals in the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]], striking at both ends in each half as Benfica salvaged a 2–2 away draw against [[FC Astana|Astana]].{{cite web|title=Benfica fight back to eliminate Astana|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2016/matches/round=2000634/match=2015742/postmatch/report/index.html|website=Uefa.com|access-date=25 November 2015}} On 9 March 2016, he helped Benfica to reach the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|quarter-finals]] of the Champions League in a 2–1 away victory against [[FC Zenit Saint Petersburg|Zenit Saint Petersburg]]. In the 85th minute of the match, Jimenéz struck a long-range shot which was saved by [[Yuri Lodygin]] onto the bar, with the ball rebounding to [[Nicolás Gaitán]] who tied the match 1–1.{{cite news |date=9 March 2016 |title=Zenit St Petersburg 1-2 Benfica (1-3 agg) |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35758921 |website=BBC Sport |access-date=9 March 2016}}{{cite news |last=van Poortvliet |first=Richard |date=9 March 2016 |title=Benfica's Zenit late show wins quarter-final spot |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2016/matches/round=2000635/match=2015769/postmatch/report/index.html |website=UEFA |access-date=9 March 2016}} On 9 April, he came off the bench and scored the winning goal in the 2–1 victory against [[Associação Académica de Coimbra – O.A.F.|Académica]], securing Benfica's lead in the [[2015–16 Primeira Liga|Primeira Liga]].{{cite news |date=9 April 2016 |title=Raúl Jiménez da triunfo al Benfica y lo mantiene como líder |trans-title=Raúl Jiménez gives the victory to Benfica who remain in lead |url=http://www.excelsior.com.mx/adrenalina/2016/04/09/1085543 |language=Spanish |newspaper=Excélsior |access-date=10 April 2016}} Four days later, due to the suspension of [[Jonas Gonçalves Oliveira|Jonas]] in the first leg, Jiménez started the second leg of the Champions League quarter-final match against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]], scoring the first goal in the 2–2 draw at the [[Estádio da Luz]]; a 3–2 defeat on aggregate meant Benfica were eliminated from the competition.{{cite web|title=Benfica 2-2 Bayern Munich |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36020598 |publisher=BBC Sport |access-date=13 April 2016}} On 24 April, he scored another winner in the league, this time scoring the lone goal against [[Rio Ave F.C.|Rio Ave]], extending Benfica's lead in the league.{{cite news |last=Castro |first=Gaspar |date=24 April 2016 |title=Jiménez lança o Benfica de volta para o topo |trans-title=Jiménez puts Benfica back into the lead |url=https://desporto.sapo.pt/futebol/primeira_liga/artigo/2016/04/24/jimenez-lanca-o-benfica-de-volta-para-o-topo |language=Portuguese |website=SAPO Desporto |access-date=10 May 2016}} On 15 May, Jiménez came on as a second-half substitute as Benfica were crowned league champions after defeating [[Clube Desportivo Nacional|Nacional]] 4–1.{{cite web|title=Raúl Jiménez, campeón con el Benfica |trans-title=Raúl Jiménez, champion with Benfica |url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/internacional/cronicas/2016/05/15/raul-jimenez-campeon-con-el-benfica_65519 |language=Spanish |website=Medio Tiempo |access-date=15 May 2016}} Five days later, he capped off the [[2015–16 S.L. Benfica season|season]] scoring from the penalty spot in the 6–2 win over [[C.S. Marítimo|Marítimo]] in the [[2016 Taça da Liga Final|Taça da Liga final]], where he also finished as the competition's top goalscorer with four goals.{{cite news|last=Myson|first=Chris|date=20 May 2016|title=Benfica romp to Taça da Liga success|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/91/portugal/2016/05/20/23766642/benfica-romp-to-taca-da-liga-success|website=Goal.com|access-date=21 May 2016}} ====2016–17 season==== On 21 July 2016, it was announced that Benfica had purchased the remaining 50% of Jiménez's economic rights for €12 million.{{cite web|url=http://web3.cmvm.pt/sdi/emitentes/docs/FR61071.pdf|title=Comunicado|date=21 July 2016|website=CMVM|language=Portuguese|trans-title=Announcement|format=PDF|access-date=21 July 2016}} It was widely reported that this had brought the total value of his transfer to around €22 million, making Jiménez the most expensive player in Portuguese football history,{{refn|group=note|This remains unsubstantiated, since the €9.836 million spent by Benfica in 2015 included various costs besides the transfer fee.{{cite web|url=http://web3.cmvm.pt/sdi/emitentes/docs/fsd150611.pdf#66|date=14 April 2016|title=Prospeto de oferta pública(...)|website=CMVM|language=Portuguese|format=PDF|page=66|access-date=21 July 2016}} }}{{cite web|title=OFICIAL: Benfica paga mais 12 milhões por Jiménez |trans-title=OFFICIAL: Benfica pay another 12 million for Jiménez |url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/raul-jimenez/liga/oficial-benfica-paga-mais-12-milhoes-por-jimenez |work=Mais Futebol |language=Portuguese |access-date=22 July 2016}} and the most expensive Mexican player.{{cite web|last=Rosenblatt |first=Ryan |date=22 July 2016 |title=Raul Jimenez becomes the most expensive Mexican transfer ever |url=http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/story/raul-jimenez-mexico-el-tri-benfica-atletico-madrid-transfer-072116 |publisher=Fox Soccer |access-date=22 July 2016}} In that season, he played in the [[2017 Taça de Portugal Final|Taça de Portugal final]], which Benfica won over [[Vitoria S.C.|Vitória de Guimarães]] (2–1).https://www.abola.pt/jogodireto/ficha.aspx?id=251730&wtv=&page=c&tipo=info&a=1&f=1&c=1&mc=0&mcres=1&gl=1&src=Info ====2017–18 season==== Jiménez came off the bench to score Benfica's third goal in their 3–1 Supertaça de Oliveira victory over Vitória de Guimarães. On 17 December, Jiménez made his 100th appearance for Benfica in all competitions following an away 5–1 win over [[C.D. Tondela|Tondela]].{{cite web|title=Raúl Jiménez y sus 100 partidos con Benfica|url=https://www.goal.com/es-mx/noticias/raul-jimenez-y-sus-100-partidos-con-benfica/1h4njre6tc2jy1nfvbf3pejg7o|work=Goal|language=Spanish|date=17 December 2017|accessdate=25 October 2018}} ====Wolverhampton Wanderers (loan)==== On 12 June 2018, Benfica loaned out Jiménez to newly-promoted [[Premier League]] side [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] on a season-long loan for a fee of €3 million with a buyout clause of €38 million.{{cite web|title=Jimenez completes Molineux move|url=https://www.wolves.co.uk/news/first-team/20180612-jimenez-completes-molineux-move/|date=12 June 2018|website=Wolverhampton Wanderers}}{{cite news|date=12 June 2018 |title=Raúl Jiménez loaned out to Wolverhampton|url=https://www.slbenfica.pt/en-us/agora/noticias/2017_2018/06/12/futebol-benfica-raul-jimenez-emprestado-ao-wolverhampton|language=Portuguese|website=S.L. Benfica|access-date=13 June 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://web3.cmvm.pt/sdi/emitentes/docs/FR68989.pdf|title=Comunicado|date=12 June 2018|website=CMVM|publisher=S.L. Benfica|language=Portuguese|trans-title=Announcement|format=PDF|access-date=13 June 2018}} On 29 June, it was reported that he had extended his contract with Benfica until June 2021 before being loaned out.{{cite news|date=29 June 2018|title=Raúl Jiménez renovou até 2021 antes de ser emprestado ao Wolverhampton|trans-title=Raúl Jiménez renewed until 2021 before being loaned out to Wolverhampton|url=https://desporto.sapo.pt/futebol/primeira-liga/artigos/raul-jimenez-renovou-ate-2021-antes-de-ser-emprestado-ao-wolverhampton|language=pt|work=SAPO Desporto|access-date=30 June 2018}} Jiménez made his unofficial debut with the team on 22 July in a semifinal match against [[VfL Bochum]] in the H-Hotels Cup, where he failed to convert a penalty, the first following his perfect conversion rate.{{cite web|title=Raúl Jiménez missed a penalty in his debut with Wolverhampton, short streak! |url=https://www.archysport.com/raul-jimenez-missed-a-penalty-in-his-debut-with-wolverhampton-short-streak-the-monclova-press/|website=Archysport.com|date=23 July 2018|accessdate=15 October 2018}} On 11 August, Jiménez marked his competitive debut for Wolves by scoring the equalizing goal that earned the home team a 2–2 draw with visiting [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on the opening weekend of the Premier League [[2018–19 Premier League|season]].{{cite web|title=Wolves 2-2 Everton |url= https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45067374 |publisher=BBC Sport |access-date=11 August 2018}} On 16 September, Jiménez scored the only goal in the victory over [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].{{cite web|title=Wolves 1-0 Burnley |url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45462680 |publisher=BBC Sport |access-date=16 September 2018}} On 22 September, he provided an assist to [[João Moutinho]] to tie the match 1–1 against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in the league.{{cite web|title=Wolves hold struggling Man U to 1-1 in EPL|url=https://apnews.com/956a5d1db20446f8960dc35b54a25394|work=AP News|date=22 September 2018|access-date=1 October 2018}} On 29 September, he provided an assist to [[Ivan Cavaleiro]] to score the first goal in a 2–0 victory over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].{{cite web|title=Wolves leave it late to beat Southampton and continue hot start|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/wolves-vs-southampton-final-score-match-report-premier-league-epl-goals-video-a8560981.html|work=The Independent|date=29 September 2018|accessdate=8 October 2018}} On 6 October, Jiménez provided the assist for [[Matt Doherty (footballer born 1992)|Matt Doherty]]'s goal in his team's 1–0 away victory over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]; it was his third assist of the season, meaning Jiménez was involved in a goal in each of the previous four league games for Wolves, assisting in the past three after scoring in the game prior to that.{{cite web|title=Crystal Palace 0-1 Wolves |url= https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45689299 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=6 October 2018}} On 11 November, he provided the assist to Ivan Cavaleiro in the 1–1 draw against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], taking his season assist tally to four.{{cite web|title=Nuno proud of Wolves display at Arsenal|url=https://www.goal.com/en/news/nuno-espirito-santo-proud-wolves-arsenal-premier-league/ku75mdst8s5f1eco6f2o4o1r0|work=Goal.com|first=Ryan|last=Benson|date=11 November 2018|accessdate=13 November 2018}} Jiménez scored Wolves' first goal in a 2–1 win against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] at [[Molineux Stadium|Molineux]] on 5 December.{{cite news|title=Wolves 2–1 Chelsea:Raùl Jiménez & Diogo Jota inspire hosts to victory|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46367295|first=Michael |last=Emons |date=5 December 2018}} Jiménez scored the first goal in Wolves's 2–0 win over [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]] on 15 December. This was the first time Wolves had won three consecutive Premier League games and the first time Wolves had won three in a row in the top flight of English football since 1980.{{cite news|title=Wolves 2–0 Bournemouth|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46491856|first=Rory |last=McAtamney |date=21 December 2018}} ==International career== ===Mexico U23=== ====2012 Toulon Tournament==== In 2012, Jiménez was selected by coach [[Luis Fernando Tena]] to participate in the [[2012 Toulon Tournament]] with the under-23 national team. Jiménez managed to score Mexico's third goal in the 4–2 victory over the [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands]] in the semi-finals on 30 May.{{cite web|last=Gomez|first=Eric|title=Mexico U23 4-2 Netherlands U23: El Tri, Fabian make Toulon history|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/114/mexico/2012/05/30/3137538/mexico-u23-4-2-netherlands-u23-el-tri-fabian-make-toulon?ICID=AR_RA_2|publisher=Goal.com|access-date=31 May 2012}} Mexico would subsequently win the final, defeating [[Turkey A2 national football team|Turkey]] 3–0.{{cite web|last=Gomez|first=Eric|title=Mexico U23 3-0 Turkey U23: El Tri win their first Toulon tournament|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/114/mexico/2012/06/01/3142505/mexico-u23-3-0-turkey-u23-el-tri-win-their-first-toulon|publisher=Goal.com|access-date=1 June 2012}} ====2012 Summer Olympics==== Jiménez made the final cut in the squad participating in the [[2012 Summer Olympics]] in [[London, England|London]].[http://miseleccion.mx/noticias/convocatoria-de-la-seleccion-mexicana-para-juegos-olimpicos/ "Convocatoria de la Selección Mexicana para Juegos Olimpicos"]. (In Spanish) ''Mi Seleccion''. Retrieved 20 June 2012. He made his Olympic debut in the group stage match against [[South Korea national under-23 football team|South Korea]] on 26 July, which ended in a 0–0 draw, with Jiménez coming in as a substitute and coming close to scoring a late goal, with the ball ricocheting off the goalkeeper's left-hand post.https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/olympics/2012/stories/18911187 He subsequently made appearances against [[Switzerland national under-23 football team|Switzerland]],[http://www.london2012.com/football/event/men/match=fbm400b05/index.html?v=20120801-165824816: "Mexico vs. Switzerland"]. London 2012. Retrieved 1 August 2012. [[Senegal national football team|Senegal]],[http://www.london2012.com/football/event/men/match=fbm400303/index.html: "Mexico vs. Senegal"]. London 2012. Retrieved 4 August 2012. [[Japan national under-23 football team|Japan]],[http://www.london2012.com/football/event/men/match=fbm400202/index.html: "Mexico vs. Japan"]. London 2012. Retrieved 7 August 2012. and [[Brazil national under-23 football team|Brazil]] in the final, coming on as a substitute in those matches. Mexico would go on to defeat Brazil 2–1 and win the gold medal.[http://www.london2012.com/football/event/men/match=fbm400101/index.html: "Mexico vs. Brazil"]. London 2012. Retrieved 11 August 2012.{{cite web|last=Borden|first=Sam|title=Mexico Has Its Moment in Upset Over Brazil|url=http://mobile.nytimes.com/2012/08/12/sports/olympics/mexico-downs-brazil-in-olympics-soccer.html|publisher=''[[The New York Times]]''|access-date=11 August 2012}} ===Mexico national team=== Jiménez made his debut for the senior national team in a 1–1 draw against [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]] on 30 January 2013, coming on as a second-half substitute.{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/sports/2013/01/31/mexico-and-denmark-play-to-1-1-draw-in-exhibition-match/|title=Mexico and Denmark play to 1-1 draw in exhibition match|work=Fox News}} ====2013 FIFA Confederations Cup==== On 20 May 2013, Jiménez was named in the 23-man squad participating in the [[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup]] held in Brazil,{{cite web|title=Convocatoria de la Selección Mayor|url=http://www.femexfut.org.mx/portalv2/aspx/WEB_DetalleNoticia.aspx?pnIDNtca=40982|publisher=Femexfut|language=Spanish|access-date=20 May 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130608013603/http://www.femexfut.org.mx/portalv2/aspx/WEB_DetalleNoticia.aspx?pnIDNtca=40982|archivedate=8 June 2013|df=}} and featured in all three group games for a combined 96 minutes. On 22 June, he was named in the starting eleven for the third match against [[Japan national football team|Japan]], being substituted off in the 90th minute for [[Javier Aquino]] in Mexico's 2–0 victory.{{cite web|title=Japan 1 Mexico 2: Hernandez heads home twice before shocking late miss as both teams bow out of Confederations Cup|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2346601/Japan-1-Mexico-2-Confederations-Cup--match-report-Javier-Hernandez-scores-twice-misses-penalty.html|publisher=''Daily Mail''|access-date=22 June 2013}} ====2013 CONCACAF Gold Cup==== On 26 June 2013, it was announced that Jiménez was included in Mexico's 23-man squad for the [[2013 CONCACAF Gold Cup]], replacing midfielder [[David Cabrera Pujol|David Cabrera]] due to injury.{{cite web|title=Raúl Jiménez jugará la Copa Oro|url=http://www.espn.go.com/deportes/nota?storyId=1835794&src=desktop&cc=3888|website=ESPN Deportes|language=Spanish|access-date=26 June 2013}}{{dead link|date=April 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} He was a starter and played in every group stage match, managing to score against [[Canada men's national soccer team|Canada]] in Mexico's 2–0 win on 11 July.{{cite web|last=Mayers|first=Joshua|date=11 July 2013|title=Mexico knocks off Canada, 2–0, in Gold Cup match|url=http://www.seattletimes.com/sports/sounders/mexico-knocks-off-canada-2-0-in-gold-cup-match/|publisher=''The Seattle Times''|access-date=12 July 2013}} On 20 July, Jiménez scored the only goal in the quarterfinal victory over [[Trinidad and Tobago national football team|Trinidad and Tobago]].{{cite web|last=Lee Rigg|first=Zach|date=21 July 2013|title=Mexico Edged Trinidad & Tobago: Raul Jimenez Goal Lifts El Tri Into Gold Cup Semifinal (VIDEO)|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/07/21/mexico-gold-cup-trinidad-tobago_n_3630022.html|website=The Huffington Post|access-date=21 July 2013}} Mexico would be eliminated by [[Panama national football team|Panama]] in the semifinal. ====2014 FIFA World Cup==== During the World Cup qualifier match against [[Panama national football team|Panama]] on 11 October 2013, in which Mexico needed a victory to not complicate the qualification process, Jiménez would go on to score a [[bicycle kick]] goal that led to Mexico's 2–1 victory.{{cite web|title=Bicycle kick goal gives Mexico win|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/news/story/_/id/1580882/raul-jimenez-bicycle-kick-gives-mexico-win-panama|work=ESPN|access-date=13 July 2018}} On 5 June 2014, Jiménez was confirmed in coach Miguel Herrera's final 23-man team participating in the 2014 FIFA World Cup.{{cite web|title=Mexico squad for 2014 World Cup: the 23 chosen by Miguel Herrera|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jun/05/mexico-squad-2014-world-cup|work=[[The Guardian]]|access-date=5 June 2014}} He did not appear in Mexico's opener against [[Cameroon national football team|Cameroon]]. On 17 June, Jiménez made his World Cup debut against host nation [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]], entering as a substitute for [[Giovani dos Santos]] in the 84th minute.{{cite web|last=Smith|first=Ben|date=17 June 2014|title=Brazil 0-0 Mexico|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/25285134|work=BBC Sport|access-date=17 June 2014}} ====2015 Copa América==== In Mexico's second game of the [[2015 Copa América]] tournament against hosts [[Chile national football team|Chile]], Jiménez headed from a corner to give Mexico the 2–1 lead in an eventual 3–3 draw at the [[Estadio Nacional Julio Martínez Prádanos|Estadio Nacional]].{{cite news|title=Hosts Chile draw with Mexico in six-goal Copa América thriller|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jun/16/chile-draw-mexico-copa-america-thriller|access-date=24 June 2015|work=[[The Guardian]]|publisher=Reuters|date=16 June 2015}} In their next match against [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]] on 19 June, he scored from the penalty spot after [[Gabriel Achilier]] brought down [[Hugo Ayala]], but the 1–2 defeat saw Mexico eliminated in last place in [[2015 Copa América Group A|their group]].{{cite news|title=Bolanos, Valencia score as Ecuador bounce Mexico from Copa America|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/copa-america/match/409844/mexico-ecuador/report|access-date=24 June 2015|publisher=ESPN|date=20 June 2015}} ====2017 FIFA Confederations Cup==== [[File:2017 Confederation Cup - MEXNZL - Raúl Jiménez.jpg|thumb|upright=1.00|Jiménez at the 2017 FIFA Confederations Cup]] Jiménez scored his only goal in the tournament against [[New Zealand national football team|New Zealand]] to tie the game 1–1; the team would go on winning the match 2–1.https://www.si.com/planet-futbol/2017/06/21/mexico-new-zealand-confederations-cup-goals-video-chicharito-vela-dos-santos ====2018 FIFA World Cup==== Jiménez was named in Mexico's 23-man final squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb He would go on to appear as a substitute in both the first group stage match against [[Germany national football team|Germany]] and the round-of-16 match against [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] but did not score. ==Style of play== A forward, Jiménez is known for his physical presence in the penalty area, as well as his ability to hold-up play and his ability in the air, which allows him to head long passes on or bring the ball down and bring others into play.{{cite web|title=Raúl Jiménez - The Mexican Tank |url=http://www.marca.com/2014/08/15/en/football/spanish_football/1408135890.html |work=Marca|first=Marcos|last=López|date=15 August 2014|access-date=19 September 2018}} He has been described as a "traditional number 9".{{cite web|title=Raul Jimenez The Expert View|url=https://www.wolves.co.uk/news/club/20180612-raul-jimenez-the-expert-view/|work=Wolves.co.uk|date=12 June 2018|access-date=19 September 2018}} His playing style has been compared to [[Zlatan Ibrahimović]]{{cite web|title=Talentos de Exportación: Raúl Jiménez, el 'Zlatan' de América |url=http://www.goal.com/es-mx/news/4851/especiales/2013/04/08/3886246/talentos-de-exportaci%C3%B3n-ra%C3%BAl-jim%C3%A9nez-el-zlatan-de-am%C3%A9rica |work=Goal.com|first=Eric|last=Gómez|date=8 April 2013|access-date=19 September 2018}}{{cite web|title=Raúl Jiménez, el Zlatan Ibrahimovic mexicano |url=http://www.goal.com/es/news/4194/editoriales/2014/08/12/5029707/ra%C3%BAl-jim%C3%A9nez-el-zlatan-ibrahimovic-mexicano |work=Goal.com|first=Andrés|last=Crona Zurita|date=12 August 2014|access-date=19 September 2018}}{{cite web|title=Raúl Jiménez: el 'Zlatan mexicano', prensa lusa |url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol/internacional/noticias/2014/05/14/raul-jimenez-el-zlatan-mexicano-prensa-lusa |work=Medio Tiempo|date=14 May 2014 |access-date=19 September 2018}}{{cite web|title=¿Son exageradas las comparaciones entre Raúl Jiménez y Zlatan Ibrahimovic?|url=https://www.sdpnoticias.com/deportes/2014/05/15/son-exageradas-las-comparaciones-entre-raul-jimenez-y-zlatan-ibrahimovic?fb_comment_id=757483710962886_757503850960872#f28d62ea895336|work=SDP Noticias|date=15 May 2014|access-date=19 September 2018}} and [[Olivier Giroud]].{{cite web|title=Don Hutchison compares Wolves' Raul Jimenez to Chelsea's Olivier Giroud|url=https://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2018/11/13/do-don-hutchison-compares-wolves-raul-jimenez-to-chelseas-olivie/|website=Hitc.com|first=Danny|last=Owen|date=13 November 2018|accessdate=13 November 2018}} Jiménez is also known for his high penalty conversion rate.{{cite web|title=Raúl Jiménez, infalible en los tiros
